lexUnit.name: throw.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move quickly, hurriedly, or roughly

sentence.text: Karen threw her arms round my neck , spilling champagne everywhere .
He ran up to her , throwing his arms round her , but saying nothing .
He gave a squeal of delight , turning round on the spot and throwing his little arms around her .
She had thrown herself into his arms and hugged him as if she were still a schoolgirl .
The little Priapus threw up his arms at me , jeering his pagan smile at my English face .
He laughed out loud and threw up both his arms in triumph .
She threw herself into his arms at every opportunity , and like a gentleman he kissed her back .
She throws her arms about Crilly 's neck .
Carrie floundered excitedly through the snow to greet him and it seemed she was about to throw her arms about him .
Fast jabs to the face are ideal for this purpose , because if they look effective they cause the opponent to throw back his head .
He threw back his head and roared with laughter .
Hawker threw back his head and laughed .
She threw back her head , and yelled for Jerry .
She threw her head back , her sherry-coloured eyes ablaze with defiance .
Stok stood up and put his hands on the small of his back and threw his head back like a man in pain .
She threw her head back defiantly .
After twenty paces , I threw myself flat , rolled to the edge and over .
She threw her hands wide , flummoxed as much by his attitude as the question .
I stood up , waited until he noticed me , took one last look round , then waved my hands high over my head and threw myself flat .
He could not recall lurching like a drunk across the small room and throwing himself in a gibbering heap upon the bed .
As we reached the shore of the island Maha threw her hands in the air , clasping them in a boxer 's sign of victory .
Frau Nordern threw her hands in the air .
Scott threw himself with enthusiasm into this exacting assignment .
The July sunlight on his shoulders felt like a weight too , but the door did n't budge , not until Charlie stumped along the weedy path and threw his weight against the door .
Why he chose to throw his weight behind a man who stood such a slender chance remains unclear .
The nurse came to the bed to fix it and as she bent her head down the woman threw her left hand round the warm brown neck and pulled it to her .
He throws himself without a word onto the blanket beside him .
He threw himself down on the huge old bed and stared at the sloping timber ceiling .
Out in the corridor , Gazzer was asleep , legs sprawled out , head thrown back , mouth wide open , snoring .
His head was thrown back and his mouth hung open .
She looked as if she needed a pillow ; her head was thrown back awkwardly .
His shoulders were thrown back and his jawline became rock-hard .
Most frequent call is a bubbling note very reminiscent of Curlew ( p. 139 ) , often uttered with head and neck thrown backwards .
Dressed , or rather undressed , in a satin nightdress , Adele Duncan lay with her eyes closed , one hand thrown dramatically across her face , her long dark hair tumbling over the pillows .
